alert.note: Alert for Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 04 at 5:18AM CDT until August 04 at 7:30AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Talladega. * WHEN...Until 830 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 518 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Talladega, Lincoln, Riverside, Munford, Waldo, Alpine, Talladega Superspeedway, Winterboro, Talladega Municipal Airport, Logan Martin Lake, Honda Manufacturing Of Alabama, Alpine Bay Resort, Howells Cove, Jackson Shoals, Ironaton, Country Club Estates and Chandler Springs.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
